div.div: Member of the Starved Rock Conference

div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 14:35 pm CDT

div.span: Sunny, with a high near 64. North wind around 5 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 39. Calm wind.

A 50 percent chance of showers, mainly after 1pm. Increasing clouds, with a high near 61. Light southeast wind becoming southwest 10 to 15 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 25 mph. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

div.p: Governor Pritzker announced that schools will remain closed to physical student attendance for the remainder of the academic year. Teachers will continue to conduct remote learning for the rest of the school year.

We will have another packet pickup on May 1st. If the teacher asked for the packet returned, drop it off on May 1st during pickup. If you have been sending pictures of work to your child’s teacher, there is no need to return those papers. Please note that the work that has been assigned MUST be completed. If no work is completed, your child will not be promoted to the next grade.

If your child has items in a desk or locker, you can also pick up those items on May 1st. If you have multiple children at JFK, you can pick up all of the packets at the same time. Again, we ask that you don’t leave your car. When you pull up, please open the back of your vehicle, and we will put all items in the back. This pickup will work like the first one:

9:00-10:00 - Pre school
10:00-11:00 - Kindergarten
11:00-12:00 - 1st grade
12:00:-1:00 - 2nd grade
1:00-2:00 - All others who need to pick up a packet or belongings

The end of the school year has changed. Our last day of remote learning will be on May 13th. We know that it is important for your child to say good-bye to their teachers, and for the teachers to say good-bye to the students. Most teachers will be at school during the designated time frames on May 14th, 15th, and 18th. To help keep everyone safe, please wear a mask and stay in your vehicle. We ask that you bring all library books, textbooks, and iPads on the the following days:

9:00-10:00 - 6th grade
10:00-11:00 - 7th grade
11:00-12:00 - 8th grade
6:00 p.m.-7:00 p.m. - Night drop off for anyone who couldn’t make a day time.

Although we anticipated the Governor’s announcement, this action still created a great deal of emotion. None of us could have ever predicted such a thing to occur. If there is anything you need or you have questions please contact a teacher or an administrator. Further announcements will follow in regards to graduation. We promise to honor our graduates at some point. We would like to thank the effort and support parents and JFK staff have shown during these trying times. We hope all of you stay healthy and safe.

span.strong: Food Donation to Hall Food Pantry
District #99 donated a substantial amount of food, paper products and cleaning supplies to the Hall Food Pantry to help our local families.
